_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!

We’re excited to share that 10 cm of fresh snow fell overnight. Thanks to the hard work of our teams, the mountain is in excellent condition this morning. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced skier, there’s something for everyone. Join us for a fantastic day on the slopes.

Plus 4 open terrain parks for all levels — from first-timers to seasoned riders. Come ride with us today.

Looking to explore beyond the lifts? We have 15 designated areas open for those who prefer Snowshoeing or Alpine Touring. Enjoy the fresh snowfall while discovering quieter corners of the mountain and taking in the winter scenery.

Fresh snow is waiting—see you out soon! 

Mountain safety tip of the week: Be careful when using the ski lifts.
Knowing how to board ski lifts is essential to ensure the safety of all users.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This Monday, we received 10 cm of fresh snow. Thanks to the hard work of our teams, the mountain is in excellent condition with 98 trails open, 70 groomed runs, 4 snow parks, & 15 sections for Alpine Touring and Snowshoeing. Fresh snow is waiting—see you out soon! Please remember to ski and ride safely at all times.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Ce lundi, nous avons reçu 10 cm de neige fraîche. Grâce au travail ardu de nos équipes, la montagne est en excellente condition avec 98 pistes ouvertes, 70 pistes damées, 4 parks à neige et 15 sections pour le ski de randonnée et la raquette. La neige fraîche vous attend, à bientôt ! N'oubliez pas de skier et de glisser en toute sécurité en tout temps.
